WorkItem.ClosedComment: I don't believe this is an issue any more, or at least, I'm not seeing it on my DC Win7 machine w/ multithreading enabled in Rawr... closing.
WorkItem.Description:
Hard one to peg down here.  I loaded up Rawr, loaded up an old tanking profile for my DK tank, and refreshed it from armory.  I noticed for some reason, the 40 stam wrist enchant was getting a very high amount of mitigation attributed to it, to the point where it beats out the 102 stam fur lining (which had no mitigation attributed to it).  The same thing was shown for the 10 stats to chest enchant, gaining an impossible amount of mitigation, putting it over the 275 health one.  My character has both of these "bugged" enchants active on my items at the time.
 
Changing what was being displayed on the Comparisons pane did not affect this.  But toggling off the "Use Multithreading" option immediately corrected the problem.
 
Since then, I have been unable to reproduce this behavior, even using the same profile.  Sorry I can't provide more info.
WorkItem.Summary: [TankDK] Use Multithreading sometimes causes strange values

Comments.Message:
Well, please post the bugged XML, and I'll take a look.  
I thought I had worked out the multi-threaded issues, but I may have broken something in the recent optimizations I made.

Which XML file are you referring to?  I've loaded other characters and reloaded the DK's profile several times since I've observed the bug, and have not seen the erroneous values appearing again.  I'll turn Multithreading back on for my DK module and see if I see the bug again.  Which files should I try to capture and upload?
Any that fail if you are using several
